title: Jon Rahm Rallies to Win the Masters
description: The Spaniard overtook Brooks Koepka to take the green jacket, while Phil Mickelson surged up the leaderboard on Sunday to finish tied for second.

title: New Details on Intelligence Leak Show It Circulated for Weeks Before Raising Alarm
description: The FBI and Justice Department are searching for the source of what is shaping up to be one of the most damaging intelligence breaches in decades. The documents were first posted in January to a small group online on a messaging channel that trafficked in memes, jokes and racist talk.

title: Here's the Math on How Super Commuters Make It Work
description: A new breed of commuter is going to great lengths—and a lot of number-crunching—to pull off living and working in far-apart places.

title: Texas Governor Vows to Pardon Man Convicted of Killing BLM Protester
description: Daniel Perry was found guilty of murder for shooting Garrett Foster in 2020.

title: A Legal Clash Over the Abortion Pill
description: Many on the right and left want courts to set national abortion policy again.

title: Democrats for Defying Court Orders
description: Ron Wyden and Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez endorse law-breaking over an abortion drug.

title: Macron Blunders on Taiwan---and Ukraine
description: He weakens deterrence against Chinese aggression and undermines U.S. support for Europe.

title: Oklahoma's McGirt Cleanup Continues
description: Is a Choctaw immune from Tulsa traffic cops? Ask the 10th Circuit.

title: A New Roster of Top Stock-Fund Managers
description: Winners’ Circle: In a rough market, different names emerge among winning stock-pickers. But only 27 of 1,257 funds had 12-month gains.

title: 'The Super Mario Bros. Movie' Has Biggest Opening Weekend of 2023
description: The animated film racked up $146 million over three days, stomping competition in the U.S. box office.

title: Memories of and Thanks for the Print Edition
description: ‘Our copy of the Long Island Press was delivered on bicycle by one Donald J. Trump.’

title: The Many Crises the Fed Was Made to Prevent
description: There have been 15 to 17 recessions and a couple of depressions since its inception.

title: Brandon Johnson, Chicago's Same-Old Mayor
description: ‘Voters complained loudly about crime, then voted to stay the course.’

title: Joe Manchin Knew What He Was Voting For
description: But he is as skilled in Washington performance art as any of his colleagues.

title: Biden Beating Trump on Oil Production
description: The current president's energy policies have thus far resulted in higher oil production than at any point in U.S. history.

title: Why We Love College Sports
description: ‘The appeal of college athletics is that universities compete against one another.’

title: Abortion-Pill Ruling Draws Muted Response from GOP
description: Republicans are wary of a political fight on abortion after a string of electoral defeats in several states.

title: The Fed's Climate Studies Are Full of Hot Air
description: One finds a correlation by assigning equal weight to all countries, from China to tiny St. Vincent.

title: Why FDR Limited FDIC Coverage
description: The objective was to protect depositors, not rich people and big companies.

title: Education Freedom in North Carolina
description: State Rep. Tricia Cotham’s switch to the Republican Party clears a path toward school choice.

title: You Can't Throw the Bums Out if You've Voted With Your Feet
description: Brandon Johnson’s victory in Chicago shows the city has lost the political base for sensible reforms.

title: More Death at Biden's Border
description: A fire that killed 38 migrants in Mexico reveals the spillover effects of bad policy.

title: 'The Peking Express' Review: Luxury Off the Rails
description: A train heist in early 1920s China set in motion a flurry of diplomatic exchanges and attempts to parley with the outlaws.

title: U.S. Soccer Star Mallory Swanson Injures Knee in Possible Blow to World Cup Hopes
description: The 24-year-old forward has been the top U.S. scorer this year. The Women’s World Cup is 3½ months away.

title: Turn Off the Fed Bubble Machine
description: Trying to ramp up aggregate demand serves no purpose if supply is constrained.

title: A Biologist Explains Why Sex Is Binary
description: In an effort to confuse the issue, gender ideologues cite rare ambiguous ‘intersex’ cases.

title: Pope Francis, in Easter Message, Calls for Peace in Ukraine
description: The pontiff followed his usual practice of not naming Russia as the aggressor but prayed for the wounded and bereaved and the return of prisoners on both sides.

title: Saudi Arabia, Houthis Advance Toward Long-Term Cease-Fire in Yemen
description: Negotiators met to hammer out the final details of a long-term truce that could pave the way toward a lasting peace after eight years of war.

title: Stock Funds Rise 5.6% So Far in 2023
description: Investors looked on the bright side in the first quarter, pushing the average fund to a healthy gain.

title: WSJ Reporter's Detention Spotlights the Rise of Arrests by Authoritarian Regimes
description: The Evan Gershkovich case reflects a growing practice in which Americans are arrested to obtain concessions from the U.S.

title: Corporate Earnings Season Seen as Next Test for Stocks
description: First-quarter profits are projected to drop 6.8% from the same period a year earlier.

title: Don't Be Surprised When the Boxers Start Belting Out Opera
description: The Met turns to fighting to draw a broader audience. The bass-baritone drops 60 pounds and perfects his right hook.

title: What Is Personal Cyber Insurance---and Should You Buy It?
description: Before you do, make sure you know the answers to these common questions.

title: Tesla to Build New China Plant for Energy Storage Battery
description: The planned expansion in Shanghai comes as U.S.-China tensions rise.

title: Food Prices Are New Inflation Threat for Governments and Central Banks
description: With food commodity prices down from their peaks, widening profit margins might explain why consumers are paying more.

title: Investors Turn to Options to Minimize Risk
description: The traditional use of options is to transfer or reduce risk, rather than to take risks to amplify returns. That’s worth remembering now.

title: Private Equity's Food Binge Goes Sour
description: Firms snapped up an orange-juice company, a dessert maker and other food and beverage companies using bundles of debt before interest rates started rising.

title: More »

title: The Play-In Team That's a Preview of the NBA's Future
description: The Oklahoma City Thunder brought up the last generation of NBA superstars. After a remarkably short downturn, they’re doing it again.

title: As Ukraine Readies Counteroffensive, Russia Steps Up Campaign Against Partisans
description: Russia is deepening a crackdown on dissent in occupied areas of Ukraine, the Ukrainian military said, as Kyiv’s forces launched fresh attacks aimed at weakening Moscow’s hold in the south.

title: In a Civilian Hospital, Military Medicine Is Kept Alive
description: Army doctors and medics practice skills and relay combat lessons to trauma units.

title: Paris Protests and Israel Unrest Aren't Stopping Travelers
description: Civil unrest frequently affects travel plans. But the difference now is that many are unwilling to cancel plans after a few years of pandemic-limited travel.

description: Firms snapped up an orange-juice company, a dessert maker and other food and beverage companies using bundles of debt before interest rates started rising.

title: Saudi Arabia-Led Oil Cuts Run Into Gusher of Alternative Supplies
description: The wild card for the market lies in players such as Nigeria where production has risen unexpectedly but is prone to outages.
